intro: Lourteigia lanulata, commonly known as the woolly lourteigia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Native to tropical regions of South America, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its unique foliage and ornamental flowers make it a sought-after species in botanical gardens. The plant's structure and growth habits reflect adaptations to its native habitat, supporting a variety of pollinators.
